flixel.util.FlxStringUtil

type
class
A class primarily containing functions related to formatting different data types to strings.

Static Methods

inline formatArray(AnyArray : Array<Dynamic>) : String

parameters
AnyArray Any Array object.
returns
A comma-separated String containing the .toString() output of each element in the array.
Generate a comma-separated string from an array. Especially useful for tracing or other debug output.

inline formatFlxPoint(Point : FlxPoint, Precision : Int) : String

parameters
Point A FlxPoint object.
Precison To how many decimals x and y should be rounded.
returns
A String formatted like this: x: Point.x | y: Point.y
Generate a string representation of a FlxPoint.

inline formatMoney(Amount : Float, ?ShowDecimal : Bool, ?EnglishStyle : Bool) : String

parameters
Amount How much moneys (in dollars, or the equivalent "main" currency - i.e. not cents).
ShowDecimal Whether to show the decimals/cents component. Default value is true.
EnglishStyle Major quantities (thousands, millions, etc) separated by commas, and decimal by a period. Default value is true.
returns
A nicely formatted String. Does not include a dollar sign or anything!
Automatically commas and decimals in the right places for displaying money amounts. Does not include a dollar sign or anything, so doesn't really do much if you call say var results:String = FlxString.formatMoney(10,false); However, very handy for displaying large sums or decimal money values.

inline formatStringMap(AnyMap : Map<String, Dynamic>) : String

parameters
AnyMap A StringMap object.
returns
A String formatted like this: key1, key2, ..., keyX
Generate a comma-seperated string representation of the keys of a StringMap.

inline formatTicks(StartTicks : Int, EndTicks : Int) : String

parameters
StartTicks The first timestamp from the system.
EndTicks The second timestamp from the system.
returns
A String containing the formatted time elapsed information.
Takes two "ticks" timestamps and formats them into the number of seconds that passed as a String. Useful for logging, debugging, the watch window, or whatever else.

inline formatTime(Seconds : Float, ?ShowMS : Bool) : String

parameters
Seconds The number of seconds (for example, time remaining, time spent, etc).
ShowMS Whether to show milliseconds after a "." as well. Default value is false.
returns
A nicely formatted String, like "1:03".
Format seconds as minutes with a colon, an optionally with milliseconds too.
